content:
The image mentions the 'All Mail' folder.

Gmail stores all of it's emails - incoming, outgoing and archive - everything in the 'All Mail' folder. Gmail undertands that 'view' is not exactly very useful, so they invented 'labels'. When a 'label' eg: Inbox - which is like a type of tag is applied to the email in 'All Mail' folder, it can display a virtual copy in the server Inbox label. This means it's possible to apply more than one label to any email so it can display in more than one 'label'.

Thunderbird has no knowledge of 'labels', so it downloads whatever is displayed in the 'Inbox' or any other server label and stores it in what Thunderbird calls 'folders'. These downloads are stored as separate copies. If you subscribe to see the 'All Mail' folder then basically a complete copy of everything you already have displayed in all other folders. When you delete an email and put it into the server 'Trash' folder, gmail will auto delete it off server after 30 days and will also auto delete it from the 'All Mail' folder. If you directly delete anything from the 'All Mail' folder via Thunderbird then it will get deleted off server, so all labels get removed by default meaning that copy in eg: Inbox will also get deleted because it no longer exists. You do not need to move anything from the gmail Inbox into the 'All Mail' because if it's not in 'All Mail' then it does not exist and will not display in any folder. Basically, you should not be putting anything in 'All Mail' nor deleting from 'All Mail'.

Anything you 'Archive' just means gmail removes all labels, so email now only resides in 'All Mail' by default. This means it's very difficult to locate archived emails, advise is to create an 'Archives' folder/label and adjust the Account Settings > Copies & Folders to use that 'Archives' folder on gmail account. It means gmail will apply a new label so you can see it in 'Archives'.

I would advise you to not subscribe to see the 'All Mail' folder. In Folder Pane

  • Right click on gmail mail account name folder and select 'Subscribe'
  • Select the 'All Mail' folder
  • click on 'Unsubscribe'
  • click on 'OK'.

It is just a duplicate of everything and can be a very large folder. If you delete any email from eg: Inbox, then it also means that 'All MAil' folder will also need to resynch as it's also updated. It may also mean you need to compact that large file more frequently to remove old marked as deleted and hidden emails. If that 'All Mail' folder gets corrupted in Thunderbird then you may end up losing all your emails in one go. Corruption can occur for various reasons - lack of compacting - or if your Anti-virus decided it contains something it does not like and attempts to fix it etc or if computer crashes whilst file is being used. It's just a matter of risk and whether it's worth that risk just to see a duplicate of everything.

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO (pôvodného) profilu Thunderbirdu - zvoľte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.

content:
J Erby zei
Ik heb al veel gelezen over de authenticatie maar oplossingen leverden niets op. Kan het zijn dat er bij 1e authenticatie iets niet goed is gegaan en dat Microsoft alle vervolg pogingen uitsluit? Toevoegen van ander outlook email adres is wel gelukt

Dat is mogelijk. De verbinding betreft IMAP, dus u kunt de account eventueel verwijderen, Thunderbird afsluiten, Thunderbird weer opstarten en de account weer toevoegen. Verwijderen doet u als volgt:

  1. Ga naar het menu in Thunderbird (drie streepjes)
  2. Klik op Accountinstellingen
  3. Klik op de account die u wilt verwijderen
  4. Selecteer Account verwijderen

content:
Kedves András!

Az üzenetet a levelezőszolgáltató adja, egyszerre túl sok címzettet többnyire nem engednek a szolgáltatók. (Joggal, mert a spammerek is pontosan ezt szeretnék csinálni, és hamar feketelistán találhatja magát a felhasználó vagy a szolgáltató.) Ilyen jellegű levelekhez sokszor érdemesebb valamilyen hírlevélküldő szolgáltatást használni, nekik ez a szakterületük.

Alkalmi esetben megteszi az ütemezett körlevélküldés, erre például a Mail Merge kiegészítőt tudom javasolni, azzal egy címlistából tömegesen lehet leveleket létrehozni, és be lehet ütemezni a kiküldésüket. Viszont figyelembe kell venni, hogy a Gmail napi 500 levélnél többet nem lesz hajlandó elküldeni.

Ha esetleg ez Google Workspace fiók, és nem sima Gmail, akkor pedig a webes felületet javaslom, ott is tudsz körlevelet készíteni, és ott magasabb a napi limit (1500).

Üdv, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

content: What is a "PEC (Certified Email)"
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi Matt, PEC stands for posta elettronica certificata which means “certified email”. A certified email (PEC email) is just like a traditional email, but with the difference that it guarantees legal certainty of the sender’s identity, of the date and time of sending and receiving the email, and of its content. This communication system is currently used in Italy, Switzerland, and Hong Kong.

the client should not do this when forwarding, and in any case this does not happen with "traditional" emails that I forward

content:
Sunday is the first day of the week. The West has corrupted the seven day cycle. The sabbath is the Saturday - always has been - and, as such, is the end of the cycle.

TB will allow to set up whichever display option you prefer.

To change the calendar to show Monday, go to the cog (bottom left), then Calendar and then 'Start the week on' on the right.

content:
klausr1 said
Please see attached screenshot. This is what the cog bottom left opens: Settings General. Scroll down shows no Calendar settings anywhere.

Steps:

1. Enable the "Home" under "Calendars" by clicking "Enable". (They all appear in your screenshot.)

2. Close Thunderbird.

3. Start Thunderbird again.

4. Now Calendar should appear inside Settings.

The following link might be helpful: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1425292

Thunderbird is a mail client. It does not issue you an email address, they are provided by the likes of GMX, Google, Outlook and Yahoo among a host of others.

What you do is add your existing address to Thunderbird to mange it locally rather than in a browser.

content:
Before you do anything make sure your Firewall is allowing Thunderbird access to internet.

Exit Thunderbird Access Firewall - this might be the default that came with computer or it might be controlled by the Anti-Virus you installed. Thunderbird must be set up as an allowed program.

As this is a spectrum server you need to tell us what comes after the '@' in email address in order to know what server settings you should be using. But the following link advises you.

  • https://www.spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-server-settings


Pop incoming

  • Port: 995
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Username = full email address
  • password: same one you use to access webmail account

SMTP:

  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Username = full email address
  • password: same one you use to access webmail account

As you have updated a password then did you update the stored password as follows:

In Thunderbird

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll down to Passwords section
  • Click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • Click on 'Show Passwords'

If asked for password: Is the checkbox 'Use Primary Password' already selected ? If you have previously set up a 'Primary Password' then that is password you need to enter - this password has nothing to do with mail accounts. If checkbox 'Use Primary Password' is not selected ? You have not set this up then: When you start up computer, you get asked to enter a User Account or Microsoft account password - that is the password you need to enter.

Then you can see stored passwords.

If they are not updated to new password..

  • Right click on the relevant lines and select 'Edit PAssword'
  • Completely clear password and then type in correct password.
  • Make sure both the 'mailbox://account....and the smtp://account.... lines have correct password.
  • Click on 'Close'
  • Exit Thunderbird
  • Wait a few moments for background processes to update files.
  • Start Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Personally I would create two folders inside 'Local Folders', like 'Mail1' 'Mail2'. Inside each of them create subfolders as You want, for example: Inbox, Sent etc.

Then manually move mails from each mailbox to those created folders and remove inactive mailboxes, so they won't try to synchronize and display errors.
creator: amplidude

content: Hi, thanks for suggestion but what you mean saying "manually move ..." ? Copy & Paste emails from .thunderbird profile folder? If yes which folders and files? If not how would you do it if as I said emails don't show up under inactive accounts ?
creator: wojtekgs

content:
You can drag and drop messages from one folder to another, for example select all from inbox folder and then drag them into Local folders -> Mail1 -> Inbox.

You said You can import those messages, start TB and see all mails - don't close TB and try to move them to local folders.
creator: amplidude

content: Thanks. It works. Just Copied all emails from inactive Inbox, Sent and subfolders and Pasted them to two new Folders with the same name child folders under the Local Folder. Yes, it is kind of a workaround for this issue, but I still think there must be some Tweaks that make TB on Linux Mint behave the same way as it does on Win10. Thanks a lot for this tip. If you find something else, pls let me know.

content:
That's how mine works, too. I don't use threads and have changed the setting to see what happens and you're correct.

Are you expecting the emails to be contained within a single email, listed one after the other?

When you have threads 'on' but have the threads closed, the body of the first email displays a list of all the email correspondence so that the email can be previewed before opening. If I was to x2 click on the first email, all the emails would be opened in single windows (I use the middle setting in your display).

Maybe someone else will be able to tell you how to achieve what you're after.

content:
jwlalek said
I am expecting that double clicking on a message will result in no more than one window pop up.

First, make sure you reply to my response so that your query goes back into the line of items needing attention (if you want someone else to address an issue).

As I said, I don't have threads on but the way it works was how I explained - which may not have come across properly.

With the thread toggle 'on' but the thread collapsed, a single click on the first message shows a list of all the threads in the normal message pane. A double-click opens them all in separate window.

That seems to be 'normal'...

...how to change it to the way you want, I don't know. You could single click on the thread and then x2 click on the email you want. Sure, one more click but it'll save the hassle of multiple windows opening.

btw, TB does do things that I would prefer it not to - but my preferences aren't always what others want. I doubt if there'll ever be an Email Client like Forte Agent but, alas, that's so old I had to ditch it for security concerns. TB suits me well enough.
creator: frisée

content:
On my system, opening successive messages in a window does reuse the same window, if they are opened by double-clicking or pressing Enter. They open in separate windows if opened from the context menu.

If you don't see this, try safe/troubleshoot mode (under Help).
creator: sfhowes

content: Thank you guys for your help. Finally I found the solution! Now everything is as it should. I have changed in the "View" --> "Sort by" from "Threaded" to "Unthreaded" and voilà! I'm very happy with the result. This is best mail client and it's free! Thank you!
creator: jwlalek

content: I suggest checking count by folder, such as inbox, allmail, important. Allmail and important are duplicates of what is in inbox, trash, and sent

Err, this Microsoft and "their" is new stuff on me, and I think I will ignore it as confused thinking. I see no link to Microsoft.

First just check that your comcast setting allow a mail client. https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/third-party-email-access

Then disable any third party antivirus and try again. Defender appears to work, but most of the third party antivirus products which infest factory resets prevent the setup process from completing.

content:
Matt,

Thank you for the recommendations.

I then tried to add a new e-mail account and had the same experience. No change. I still get the "Unable to Connect". Thoughts?

creator: ploches7

content:
Please double Check: The 'allowed 3rd-party access' checkbox in Xfinity does need to be selected for each of the different comcast email accounts.


When trying to create mail account...after it finds initial settings as per your image - click on the 'Configure Manually' button and make sure you have the following:

  • Incoming Mail Server Name: imap.comcast.net
  • Port Number: 993
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name : full comcast email address.
  • password = same as password to access that particular email address in webmail account
  • Outgoing Mail Server Name: smtp.comcast.net
  • Port Number: 587
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • User name : full comcast email address.
  • password = same as password to access that particular email address in webmail account
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Toad-Hall,

Success!

The 3rd-party access checkbox was correct for each account.

But when I checked the manually settings, they were mostly wrong. So for each account I entered the values that you recommended for both Incoming and Outgoing Servers, and that took care of it.

Thanks!

Steve

content: Thanks again. The extension on the far right is 'Adobe Acrobat'. The options in the drop down box include Mail, HTML, TEXT and ALL FILES (i.e. PDF). But why are there options???? Just save an EMAIL as an EMAIL i.e. HTML. Cheers, Brent
creator: bandlhaines

content:
'Adobe Acrobat' is not an extension type. It should be a dot that precedes either three or four letters usually. It may be 'pdf', I grant you.

As for the 'Drop Down' - you have the email extension, then? Once you select it once, it then reverts to the previous selection the next time you trigger the same action.

Same for every print dialogue in Windows - ghost printer or hardcopy. Windows remembers the previous setting and begins with that selection.

content:
Check setting: On computer in search type: default select 'Default apps'

scroll to bottom select 'choose default apps by file type' Check .eml is set up to use Thunderbird

The options in the drop down box include Mail (.eml), HTML, TEXT and ALL FILES (i.e. PDF). You want to use 'Mail' and the extension added to filename needs to be .eml

But I would have expected Thunderbird to auto apply the .eml extension and therefore 'All Files' is not an issue and should work regardless. I'm still trying to find out what could be causing yours to auto use .pdf Just check ...do you by any chance have the Print set to use DEstination : Save to PDF ?

You could download and install the addon 'ImportExportTools NG' It offers a lot more options and is easy to use.

  • https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

How to install addon extension info:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/installing-addon-thunderbird

In the 'Addons Manager' tab, you will see the name of the addon extension.

  • click on the ImportExportTools NG 'Spanner' icon
  • click on 'Filenames' tab

Customise the format for Filenames.

  • select 'use following format'
  • select 'Subject' 'Name(Sender' and 'Date.......But you can set whatever you prefer.
  • click on OK

Then use : Right click on email and use 'Export message as' and choose option OR : Right click on folder and use 'ImportExportTools NG' and choose option
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Thanks Toad-Hall. The default apps options worked. Cheers Brent
creator: bandlhaines
